ff7a032a-38cf-4776-804b-342f6c2803ab.value: It's Time To Check In For Your Flight

body_html:
Delta Air Lines
Review important airport and flight information.
View as a web page
                  
Join SkyMiles®

Confirmation Number
HSRD5C
 
CHECK IN ONLINE
Your flight on Thursday, October 10 is available for check-in. Prepare for your flight by reviewing the below itinerary and information on prohibited items for checked or carry-on bags.
Trip Details
Thursday
October 10 		DEPART ARRIVE SEAT
383
Operated by Delta Air Lines, Inc
 San Francisco Intl, California
09:55 am 		Kennedy Intl, New York
06:40 pm 		31F
Prefer a Different Flight Time?
Making changes to your trip is easier than ever. If a different flight is available – and you are within 24 hours of departure – you can request to fly standby that same day. The best part? You can make the request on My Trips without paying a fee or contacting an agent. Visit Same-Day Flight Changes for more information. Terms apply.
Save Time At The Airport
Prepay for checked bag fees, if applicable, online during check-in. Then use our self-service airport kiosks to print your bag tag and attach it to your bag before dropping it with an agent. Pay For Bags Through MyTrips ›
Arrive Early For Your Flight
Allow extra time for check-in and security screening before your flight. Plan to arrive at least two hours prior to your scheduled departure time for domestic flights and three hours for international flights. Review when check-in closes for your flight.
Plan Ahead To Navigate SFO Terminal Change
As of Oct. 8, all Delta check-in counters will operate out of Terminal 1 at the San Francisco International Airport (SFO). Customers should follow airport signage to their departure gates. Explore the airport using the map on the SFO website.
Know Where To Access Rideshare Pickup At JFK
Due to construction, the rideshare (Lyft/Uber) pick-up area at JFK will be located at a remote pick-up lot from 12:00 p.m. to 2:00 a.m. daily. Passengers arriving in Terminal 4 may access the rideshare pick-up area via shuttle bus that picks up curbside in Terminal 4. Curbside pick-up will continue to be available for customers with disabilities. Learn more on the JFK Airport website.
Check Bags Easily With Curbside Check-In At SFO
If you’re arriving by car and only need to check bags, consider using curbside check-in offered by our service partners. Look for the dedicated counters on the curb of Delta’s terminal airport. Explore all your check-in options on delta.com.
Review Restricted Hazardous Items Before You Board
For the safety of all travelers and airport staff, certain items must not be brought on board or checked in baggage.

Lithium-ion batteries found in smart bags, portable chargers, vape pens and more are not allowed in your checked baggage. Additionally, firearms (loaded or unloaded) are not permitted through TSA security checkpoints. For more information on the transport of firearms, firearms parts and ammunition, visit the TSA website.

Delta will not accept the following as carry-on or checked baggage on any Delta mainline or Delta Connection flight:
  • Smart bags with non-removable lithium-ion batteries
  • Self-balancing transportation devices (Hoverboards)
  • Damaged, defective and/or recalled lithium batteries
Further information and specific guidelines regarding restricted items can be found on delta.com.

Your Pre-Trip Checklist For Easier Travel

Join
SkyMiles®

Start earning miles that don't expire for free.
Join Now ›

Fly Delta
App

Track your bags, check your flight status, get your boarding pass, message us and more.
Download Now ›

Baggage Calculator

Get an estimate of your baggage allowance and fees for your upcoming trip.
Calculate Baggage Estimate ›

Need Additional Help?

Find answers to your travel questions with information on self-service tools, baggage, SkyMiles and more through our Help Center.

Visit Help Center ›
Help Center • Flight Deals • Earn Miles • Stays & Cars
Privacy Policy
 
 
Conditions of Carriage

Air transportation on Delta and the Delta Connection® carriers is subject to Delta's conditions of carriage. They include terms governing for example: 

• Limits on our liability for personal injury or death of passengers, and for loss, damage of delay of goods and baggage.
• Claim restrictions including time periods within which you must file a claim or bring action against us.
• Our right to change terms of the contract.
• Check-in requirements and other rules established when we may refuse carriage.
• Our rights and limits of our liability for delay or failure to perform service including schedule change, substitution of alternative air carriers or aircraft, and rerouting.
• Our policy on overbooking flights, and your rights if we deny you boarding due to an oversold flight. 

Advice To Passengers On Limitations Of Liability

For international travel to or from another country, airline liability is governed by the Montreal Convention or the Warsaw Convention. There are no financial limits for death or bodily injury, and the airline may make an advance payment to cover immediate economic needs. The airline's liability for passenger delay, and for loss, delay or damage to baggage may be limited by the Conventions. In case of baggage, the liability limit is 1131 Special Drawing Rights (approximately US $1787) per passenger for international travel. The baggage limit is US $3,500 per ticketed passenger for US domestic travel. These baggage liability limitations apply unless you declare a higher valuation and pay additional charges at check-in. In case of international travel, any action in court to claim damages must be brought within two years from the date of the actual or scheduled arrival of the aircraft; and, in case of baggage claims, written notice to the carrier must be made within 7 days of the receipt of checked baggage in case of damage, and, in case of delay, within 21 days from the date on which it was placed at the disposal of the passenger. If your journey also involves carriage by other airlines, you should contact them for information on their limits of liability. See the notice with your tickets or consult your airline or travel agent for further information.

Email Subscription

You are currently subscribed to receive Delta Notifications via email at BRETT@MICRO.SO. If you would like to take advantage of other Delta email programs featuring special fares, promotions and information, please update your email subscriptions on your SkyMiles profile.

Privacy Policy

Your privacy is important to us. Please review our Privacy Policy.

Effective December 15, 2019, the Canada Air Passenger Protection Regulations may provide additional protections to passengers traveling to or from Canada:

If you are denied boarding, your flight is cancelled or delayed for at least two hours, or your baggage is lost or damaged, you may be entitled to certain standards of treatment and compensation under the Air Passenger Protection Regulations. For more information about your passenger rights please contact your air carrier (www.delta.com/appr) or visit the Canadian Transportation Agency’s website.

Si l’embarquement vous est refusé, ou si votre vol est annulé ou retardé d’au moins deux heures ou si vos bagages sont perdus ou endommagés, vous pourriez avoir droit au titre du Règlement sur la protection des passagers aériens, à certains avantages au titre des normes de traitement applicables et à une indemnité. Pour de plus amples renseignements sur vos droits, veuillez communiquer avec votre transporteur aérien ( www.delta.com/appr) ou visiter le site Web de l’Office des transports du Canada.

Copyright Information

This email message and its contents are copyrighted and are proprietary products of Delta Air Lines, Inc. Delta Blvd., P.O. Box 20706 Atlanta, GA 30320-6001. Any unauthorized use, reproduction, or transfer of this message or its contents, in any medium, is strictly prohibited.


You are receiving this operational message due to your upcoming travel or recent activity with Delta. Even if you have opted-out of receiving Delta marketing communications, you may still receive operational emails with relevant information based on your upcoming travel or recent activity.

This email was sent to: BRETT@MICRO.SO

© 2024 Delta Air Lines, Inc. All rights reserved.
Delta Blvd. P.O. Box 20706 • Atlanta, GA 30320-6001

On Mon, 4 Aug 2025 at 13:45, Abigail Wachob <abigail@useparagon.com> wrote:
Hey Brett,

Unlike Pipedream and Composio, which focus on providing point solutions for specific integration use cases (ie. tool calling), Paragon provides an all-in-one integration that provides primitives for every use case, including:
  • Data ingestion for RAG
  • Tool calling / synchronous requests
  • Automations

Based on the workspace product you’re about to launch, I imagine you will need to solve for all of these use cases (ingesting emails and CRM data, auto updating 3rd-party apps, etc.)

If you have time this week to connect, we'd love to chat through this further and showcase how we compare in action.

On Mon, Aug 4, 2025 at 4:00 PM Brett Goldstein <brett@micro.so> wrote:

Hey Abigail!

We are actively evaluating integrations providers right now. Pipedream and Composio are on the list. What would make Paragon something we should look at as well?

Sent via Micro
On Mon, 4 Aug 2025 at 05:08, Abigail Wachob <abigail@useparagon.com> wrote:
Brett - Are connectors like calendars, Slack, file storage, Salesforce and Hubspot still on the roadmap?

The Sync API will enable your team to turn on full syncs of any 3rd-party object in a few lines of code and the Permissions API enables you to easily query for a user's access control on that data in RAG.

Want me to send over some more details?

Best,
Abigail Toribio
Sync Playground | Paragon




--
Best,
Abigail Toribio
Paragon | Book a Demo



--
Best,
Abigail Toribio
Paragon | Book a Demo

Banks can take up to 5 business days after the expected post date to process payouts. Wait until 5 business days have passed and then contact your bank with the payout information, including the payout trace ID.
If your bank still can't find the payout, ask them for a written statement confirming that the funds haven't been received. Then, contact Stripe Support with this statement from your bank.

body_html:
Hello, founders. Nice to meet you. My name is Fahwaz, an independent scout for Outlander VC and I am impressed with what you are building. I believe that your project is a good fit.

Outlander VC is looking for disruptive early stage start-ups and provide USD 500k-3 million in investment..

I would like to take you to the partners by sharing the application link :

In the "venture scout email " section, please put my email ID :
pemanah101@gmail.com

Here's the link:
https://forms.monday.com/forms/8b9a589eba6a6d4f4a10784efbce758a?r=use1

900deab4-7a9b-439b-9eab-d6549ea609d0.value: Chris shared frustrations about his current CRM's outdated approach and inefficiencies.

e86975bf-f22f-4197-a1e3-828616b4692b.value: Hi Brett, Regarding what I dislike most about my current CRM, where do I even begin? My primary frustration lies with the forced, unnatural actions it requires. These seem rooted in an outdated

ff7a032a-38cf-4776-804b-342f6c2803ab.value: Re: Helllooo from Micro

body_html:
Hi Brett,

Regarding what I dislike most about my current CRM, where do I even begin? My primary frustration lies with the forced, unnatural actions it requires. These seem rooted in an outdated approach to tracking people and activities rather than focusing on outcomes. I believe that if you're consistently doing the right things, the right outcomes should follow. Having to go back and update a system simply feels like a waste of valuable time.

As Steve Jobs famously said, "It doesn't make sense to hire smart people and then tell them what to do; we hire smart people so they can tell us what to do." I wish my CRM operated with this philosophy. As a founder, it doesn't make sense to hire and trust capable people to do a good job, only to then burden them with updating a system primarily for my board status reports.


Best,
Chris


On Tue, Aug 5, 2025 at 11:31 AM Brett <brett@hello.micro.so> wrote:

It's Brett, founder of Micro.
Thanks for joining the waitlist!
We're currently in private beta, but we're onboarding folks every week.
